ExecutionParameters.description:
Parameters that can be provided when executing a job
This data will be used to override the defined defaults for a single execution

agentId.description:
The target agent GUID
If omitted or NULL, The default agent will be used

browsers.description: Target browsers (Optional, will use default if none provided)

devices.description: Target devices (Optional, will use default if none provided)

queue.description: Will queue the execution if agent is currently busy and execute when the agent will be available

agent.description: The agent that is executing the job

app.description: The application that is being tested

target.description:
The current target (device / browser)
Where the job is currently running

tests.description: Tests that were executing by the job

hasDataSource.description: Is the test has a configured data source (for data driven execution)

position.description: The position on the test in the job

JobTestResult.description: Contains result information for a test that was executed in a job

NewJobTestCollection.description: Used for adding tests to existing jobs

UpdateApplication.description: Contains application information for updating applications

UpdateJob.description: Contains job information (used for job update)

info.description: TestProject exposes a RESTful API which allows R&D teams to schedule and trigger automation, get status and retrieve testing results. The API is particularly useful when you build your CI pipeline and use TestProject as a centralized test automation execution grid. This management API is auto-enabled for all TestProject accounts. If you donâ€™t have a TestProject account yet, go ahead and create a [free account](https://testproject.io).
info.title: Getting Started with TestProject API

post.description:
## A request to this endpoint will create a new application in the project.
The **name** and **platform** properties are mandatory.  
* For Web applications, the **url** property is mandatory.
* For Android applications, the **androidPackage** and the **androidActivity** properties are mandatory.
* For iOS applications, the **appleBundleId** property is mandatory.

409.description: Application with this name already exists

parameters.description: The GUID of the application to delete
parameters.name: appId

put.description:
## A request to this endpoint will update the application.
* The **platform** property cannot be updated. All other properties must be provided.
* If the application contains a file, only **name** and **description** can be updated.
* For Web applications, the **url** property is mandatory.
* For Android applications, the **androidPackage** and the **androidActivity** properties are mandatory.
* For iOS applications, the **appleBundleId** property is mandatory.

parameters.description: The GUID of the application to update
parameters.name: appId

409.description: Application with the same name already exists

post.description:
## A request to this endpoint confirms that the application file was uploaded to TestProject storage.
Use this after:  
* An upload information was received from **GET v2/projects/{projectId}/applications/{appId}/file/upload-link**
* The file was successfully uploaded to storage as binary data

get.description:
## A request to this endpoint will generate upload information to be used to update the application file
After using this:  
* Upload application file using the information received
* Confirm upload done by **POST v2/projects/{projectId}/applications/{appId}/file** and providing file information in request body
get.summary: Get an upload URL for an application

post.description:
## This will run the job on defined agent and targets (devices/browsers)
* If **executionParameters** object is provided in the request body, the job will run with these parameters
* All of the properties are optional
* Provide browsers / devices according to job platform
* If the **queue** parameter is true and the agent is currently busy, the job will be executed once the agent becomes available

parameters.description: Parameters to be used for the execution. Can be an empty object.
parameters.name: executionParameters
